title: Is there any way to refuse Kalista's passive?
body:
Title.

I got soul bound against my will.  Before I knew what was happening my champ stopped moving and I got that stupid soul bound mark thing.

I was under the impression that there would be a way to refuse this passive.  I feel violated.

Um as Soraka after you knock them up you throw your E to silence them all and then your Q for an easy slow.  Chances are you root them all while silencing for a rather long time after knocking them up.  That's a pretty long CC chain.

I could probably pull that off if I had fair warning for the ult, *which does not happen ever*, and had proper time to react. Not to mention how close it can put you and it's terror when you are trying to do something else and then Kalista ults and screws you up. happened to me in a match earlier where I was playing Lux and I was trying to get ahead of the other team's Gnar and Anivia to use my ult on them, and then Kalista ult'ed and it put me behind them instead. Didn't help that that particular one only communicated with the rest of us when she was complaining.

I played taric with a kalista.

I got 38 assists.

Why would you refuse? It is so much fun to use.

Maybe you are Galio support or Nunu support and you need to channel your ult. Or you are mid laner like Kat or Malz and Kalista wants to soulbound you instead.

Now you lose all your damage just because your Kalista has no idea how to play.
What better way to channel Galio's ult than to have Kalista throw you into the middle of their team first?

What if you are already in the middle of their team channeling the ult? Then your ult gets canceled and deals minimum damage and cc.

Not to mention Kalista can't throw you into the middle of the enemy team, it stops at first target it hits.
I have never been able to throw my duo while he's channeling as Galio, so that's not a problem.
Because it can screw you over...... trust me it does
